question: When a tertiary alcohol <katex>$A^{\prime}(C_{4}H_{10}O)$</katex> reacts with 20% <katex>$H_{3}PO_{4}$</katex> at 358 K, it gives a compound 'B' <katex>$(C_{4}H_{8})$</katex> as a major product. The IUPAC name of the compound 'B' is: [cite: 158-159]
explanation: The tertiary alcohol <katex>$C_4H_{10}O$</katex> is tert-butyl alcohol (2-methylpropan-2-ol). Dehydration yields 2-methylpropene (Isobutylene). [cite: 162, 170]
